enWisdom: Suppression [of anger] is the fruit of forbearance
The suppressor of anger is one who extirpates his grudges

Wisdom: اكْظِمِ الْغَيْظَ عِنْدَ الْغَضَبِ وَتَجَاوَزْ مَعَ الدَّوْلَةِ تَكُنْ لَكَ الْعَاقِبَةُ
enWisdom: Suppress [your] rage when you are angry and overlook [the fault of others] despite having authority, [in this way] the outcome will be in your favour

Wisdom: أَقْدَرُ النَّاسِ عَلَى الصَّوَابِ مَنْ لَمْ يَغْضَبْ
enWisdom: The person who is most capable of being on the right is one who does not get angry

Wisdom: أَفْضَلُ النَّاسِ مَنْ كَظَمَ غَيْظَهُ وَحَلُمَ عَنْ قُدْرَةٍ
enWisdom: The best of people is one who swallows his anger and displays forbearance despite having power [to take revenge]
It is through suppression [of anger] that forbearance comes about
The cornerstone of forbearance is suppression [of anger]

Wisdom: طُوبَى لِمَنْ كَظَمَ غَيْظَهُ وَلَمْ يُطْلِقْهُ عَصَى أَمْرَ نَفْسِهِ فَلَمْ يُهْلِكْهُ
enWisdom: Blessed is the one who suppresses his anger and does not let it loose, and [who] disobeys the command of his [carnal] soul and thus is not destroyed by it
One who overcomes his anger has gained victory over Satan
Satan is victorious over the one who has been overcome by his anger

Wisdom: كَمْ مِنْ غَيْظٍ تُجُرِّعَ مَخَافَةَ مَا هُوَ أَشَدُّ مِنْهُ
enWisdom: How many a time is anger suppressed out of the fear of that which is more severe than it
